Europe pushes for Ukraine role in Trump-Putin talks
subhead: Talks between Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump on the war in Ukraine are set to take place next Friday in Alaska. Europe has insisted that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and European powers should be part of any deal to end the conflict.

title: Firefighters unite to battle France's largest wildfire in decades
subhead: An exceptional response was put in place in the southern French region of Aude last week, including the deployment of 2,000 firefighters, to fight France's largest wildfire in decades.

title: When partying and protest go hand in hand: 'Celebrating together re-energizes activists'
subhead: 'Why Do We Party?' (4/6). Collectives and artists are working to put festivities at the heart of their activism. It is a way to fight activist fatigue, attract young people to their causes and escape repression.

Iceland's Eyjafjallajökull volcano is being overrun by Instagrammers
subhead: 'Of Volcanoes and Men' (4/6). Made famous by its spectacular 2010 eruption, Eyjafjallajökull in Iceland has since attracted waves of tourists armed with their smartphones. Finnish photographer Juuso Westerlund followed in the footsteps of these crowds, who have transformed a rugged, wild landscape into an Instagram backdrop.

title: Ayn Rand's irresistible attraction to the dominance of the 'alpha male,' as embodied by Elon Musk
subhead: 'Musk Fictions' (6/6). Since 2024 and his opportunistic support for Donald Trump, American billionaire Elon Musk has increasingly cited the 20th-century novelist Ayn Rand, the apostle of rational selfishness and capitalism.
